faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca combines Mediterranean lifestyle with practical family considerations—excellent schools, healthcare, and established expat communities. Property values are appreciating 8% annually, and rental income potential supports investment portfolios. The region appeals particularly to families seeking year-round outdoor living without tourist overcrowding.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-Spanish citizens can purchase property throughout Spain without visa restrictions. You'll need an NIE (fiscal number), which your lawyer obtains during the purchase process. Many law firms specialize in international property transactions and handle all documentation in English.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, budget approximately 8-10% for additional costs: stamp duty (1.5%), lawyer fees (600-1,200€), notary (300-500€), property transfer tax (6-8% depending on region), and surveys. Baños y Mendigo in Murcia region typically requires 6% transfer tax, making total costs around €68,000-78,000 for this €489,000 property.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Many Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign property buyers. Typically you can borrow 70-80% of property value, requiring 20-30% down payment. Interest rates are competitive, and some lenders specialize in expat mortgages. Your Spanish lawyer can connect you with appropriate lenders.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is 30-40% lower than UK equivalents. Groceries average 60% of UK prices, utilities cost €80-150/month depending on property size, and restaurant meals cost €8-15 for lunch. Healthcare and education through international schools are excellent value. A family of four typically lives comfortably on €2,000-2,500/month including private school.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca geschikt voor gepensioneerden?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca attracts retirees seeking affordable living, healthcare, sunshine, and social communities. Healthcare access is excellent with English-speaking doctors. The climate reduces heating costs. Golf, beaches, and restaurants provide leisure activities. Many retirees find 30-40% cost savings versus the UK while enjoying superior lifestyle quality.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: De Costa Blanca heeft een mediterraan klimaat with 300+ sunshine days annually. Summers average 28°C (May-September), winters average 13°C (December-February). Rainfall is limited to autumn/spring. The climate is ideal for year-round outdoor living, with summer heat tempered by sea breezes and winter mild enough to eliminate heating challenges faced in northern Europe.

faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, serving Costa Blanca, is 50 minutes from Baños y Mendigo. Flight time to UK is 2.5 hours to London and similar to Manchester/Glasgow.
